status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data:
Put on a flat, clean table:

  1. Nitroprusside 25mg/ml 2ml ampoule;
  2. phenylephrine 10mg/ml 1ml ampoule;
  3. Saline (NaCl 0.9%) bags: 100ml (x2) and 500ml (x1);
  4. Syringes: 20ml (x1), 5ml (x2);
  5. Intravenous catheter (22 gauge);
  6. Catheter connector (Y-connector or three-way connector);
  7. Common medical procedure gloves;
  8. Tourniquet;
  9. Alcohol 70% to clean the puncture region;
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Put on a flat, clean table:

  1. Nitroprusside 25mg/ml 2ml ampoule;
  2. phenylephrine 10mg/ml 1ml ampoule;
  3. Saline (NaCl 0.9%) bags: 100ml (x2) and 500ml (x1);
  4. Syringes: 20ml (x1), 5ml (x2);
  5. Intravenous catheter (22 gauge);
  6. Catheter connector (Y-connector or three-way connector);
  7. Common medical procedure gloves;
  8. Tourniquet;
  9. Alcohol 70% to clean the puncture region;

components.data:
Be prepared to choose between 100-150 mcg bolus dose of either drug, therefore:

  1. Dilute 50mg (2ml) of nitroprusside in 498ml of saline (bag) using a 5ml syringe. Final solution: 100mcg/ml. Identify the bag and the syringe used with 'nitro' label. Cover the bag with a black plastic bag because light will destroy nitro.
  2. Dilute 10mg (1ml) of phenylephrine in 99ml of saline (bag) using a 5ml syringe. Final solution: 100mcg/ml. Identify the bag and the syringe used with 'phenyl' label.
  3. Label a 20ml syringe and a 100ml bag as "saline".
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Be prepared to choose between 100-150 mcg bolus dose of either drug, therefore:

  1. Dilute 50mg (2ml) of nitroprusside in 498ml of saline (bag) using a 5ml syringe. Final solution: 100mcg/ml. Identify the bag and the syringe used with 'nitro' label. Cover the bag with a black plastic bag because light will destroy nitro.
  2. Dilute 10mg (1ml) of phenylephrine in 99ml of saline (bag) using a 5ml syringe. Final solution: 100mcg/ml. Identify the bag and the syringe used with 'phenyl' label.
  3. Label a 20ml syringe and a 100ml bag as "saline".

components.data:
1. Explain the procedure to the voluntary.
  2. Apply the tourniquet 5cm proximal to the basilic vein.
  3. Identify basilic vein and clean the skin area of the puncture.
  4. Put on gloves and perform catheterization. Release the tourniquet.
  5. Connect the Y-connector or tri-way.
  6. Test the catheter by aspiration and by flushing saline. Ask about pain during flush (should be painless). Examine the arm next to the catheter tip for extravascular infusion.
  7. Catheter fixation.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1. Explain the procedure to the voluntary.
  2. Apply the tourniquet 5cm proximal to the basilic vein.
  3. Identify basilic vein and clean the skin area of the puncture.
  4. Put on gloves and perform catheterization. Release the tourniquet.
  5. Connect the Y-connector or tri-way.
  6. Test the catheter by aspiration and by flushing saline. Ask about pain during flush (should be painless). Examine the arm next to the catheter tip for extravascular infusion.
  7. Catheter fixation.

components.data:
1. Aspirate 5ml of the nitro bag into the nitro syringe.
  2. Aspirate 5ml of the phenyl bag into the phenyl syringe.
  3. Aspirate 20ml of the saline bag into the salone syringe.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1. Aspirate 5ml of the nitro bag into the nitro syringe.
  2. Aspirate 5ml of the phenyl bag into the phenyl syringe.
  3. Aspirate 20ml of the saline bag into the salone syringe.

components.data:
When asked to start infusions:

Infuse nitro 100mcg then flush with 5ml of saline.

 

One minute later you will infuse phenyl 100mcg then flush 5ml of saline.

 

After the end of 2 minutes, they will tell you the adjusted doses for the next trial. There will be some time for the patient to rest before next trial.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
When asked to start infusions:

Infuse nitro 100mcg then flush with 5ml of saline.

 

One minute later you will infuse phenyl 100mcg then flush 5ml of saline.

 

After the end of 2 minutes, they will tell you the adjusted doses for the next trial. There will be some time for the patient to rest before next trial.

components.data:
Infuse nitro (new dose) then flush 5ml of saline when asked for.

 

Infuse phenyl (new dose) then flush 5ml of saline when asked for.

 

This trial sometimes needs to be repeated when technical problems occurs with monitors.
components.name: Description

components.data: Remove the catheter and ask the voluntary to press the entry point with sterile cotton.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the catheter and ask the voluntary to press the entry point with sterile cotton.
